  <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">ITEM 2.02.&#160; RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION</div>

  <div style="font-size: 10pt;">&#160;</div>

  <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">On April 22, 2022, Newmont Corporation, a Delaware corporation, issued a news release reporting its operating and financial results for the first quarter ended
    March 31, 2022. A copy of the news release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1 to this report.</div>

  <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br />
  </div>

  <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">ITEM 9.01.&#160; FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND EXHIBITS</div>

  <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br />
  </div>

  <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">(d) Exhibits</div>

  <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br />
  </div>

  <div style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Exhibit Number</span></span><span style="text-indent: 0px; font-size: 10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </span><span style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Description of Exhibit</span></span></div>

  <div style="font-size: 10pt;"><br />
  </div>

  <div style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-size: 10pt;">

<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; color: #000000;">
  <div style="text-align: right;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">Exhibit 99.1</font><br>
  </div>
  <div style="text-align: left;"><br>
    <div class="bw-release">
      <h1> <b>Newmont Announces First Quarter 2022 Results</b> </h1>
      <div class="bw-release-subhead">
        <p><b> <b>Newmont announces solid first quarter results; well-positioned to deliver a strong second half and long-term value from top-tier mining jurisdictions</b> </b></p>
      </div>
      <div class="bw-release-body">
        <div class="bw-release-table-js bw-release-story">
          <p>DENVER--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 22, 2022--Newmont Corporation (NYSE: NEM, TSX: NGT) (Newmont or the Company) today announced first quarter 2022 results. </p>
          <p> <b>FIRST QUARTER 2022 HIGHLIGHTS</b> </p>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> Produced 1.34 million attributable ounces of gold and 350 thousand attributable gold equivalent ounces from co-products </li>
            <li> Reported gold CAS<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">*</sup> of $890 per ounce and AISC<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">*</sup> of $1,156 per ounce </li>
            <li> Remain on track to achieve full-year guidance ranges; full-year results continue to be back-half weighted<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">**</sup> </li>
            <li> Generated $689 million of cash from continuing operations and $252 million of Free Cash Flow<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">*</sup> </li>
            <li> Declared first quarter dividend of $0.55 per share, consistent with the previous quarter; $1 billion share repurchase program to be used opportunistically in 2022, with $475 million remaining<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup> </li>
            <li> Ended the quarter with $4.3 billion of consolidated cash and $7.3 billion of liquidity with a net debt to adjusted EBITDA ratio of 0.3x<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">*</sup> </li>
            <li> Credit rating upgraded by S&amp;P Global Ratings to BBB+ from BBB with a stable outlook </li>
            <li> Advancing profitable near-term projects, including Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North and Yanacocha Sulfides </li>
            <li> Executed on strategy to consolidate ownership in prolific mining districts with acquisition of Yanacocha's minority interest stake; increasing ownership in Sulfides project to 100 percent through acquisition of Buenaventura's 43.65%
              interest and Sumitomo Corporation's 5% interest<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">****</sup> </li>
            <li> Published 18th Annual Sustainability report, a transparent review of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) performance </li>
            <li> Committed $5 million contribution to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine </li>
            <li> Ranked eleventh on Fortune's Modern Board 25, a list of the most innovative boards of directors among S&amp;P 500 companies; recognized for gender equality, nationality dispersion and board independence </li>
          </ul>
          <p> "Newmont delivered a solid first quarter performance with $1.4 billion in adjusted EBITDA as we safely managed through the Omicron surge. The strength of our proven operating model and global portfolio in the world's best mining jurisdictions
            is the foundation of Newmont's clear and consistent strategy to create value and improve lives through sustainable and responsible mining. In April, we published our 18th Annual Sustainability Report, which provides a transparent look at our
            ESG performance and the issues and metrics that matter most to our stakeholders. As a values-based organization and the gold sector's recognized sustainability leader, Newmont has a long history of leading change in our approach to ESG and our
            core values are fundamental to how we run our business and where we choose to operate." </p>
          <p> <b>- Tom Palmer, Newmont President and Chief Executive Officer</b> </p>
          <p> ___________________________ </p>
          <p> <i>*Non-GAAP metrics; see pages 12-26 for reconciliations. <br>
              **See discussion of outlook and cautionary statement at end of release regarding forward-looking statements. <br>
              ***See cautionary statement at the end of this release, including with respect to future dividends and share buybacks. <br>
              ****The acquisition of the remaining 5% interest in Yanacocha from Sumitomo Corporation is expected to close in Q2 2022.</i> </p>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

          </div>

                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 1,390 </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 1,599 </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>

                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 1,457 </p>

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 68%;">

                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">

                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 68%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Capital expenditures ($ millions) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>

                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 437 </p>

                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">

                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 399 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 68%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Free cash flow ($ millions) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 252 </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 858 </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 8%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 442 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
          <p> <b>Attributable gold production<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1</sup></b> decreased 8 percent to 1,344 thousand ounces from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower mill throughput at CC&amp;V, Tanami, Porcupine and Nevada Gold Mines, lower ore grades milled at
            Pe&#241;asquito, Pueblo Viejo, &#201;l&#233;onore and Porcupine, and a build-up of in-circuit inventory. These decreases were partially offset by higher ore grade milled at Boddington and higher production at Yanacocha due to the acquisition of Buenaventura's
            43.65% ownership in February 2022. </p>
          <p> <b>Gold CAS</b> totaled $1.2 billion for the quarter.<b> Gold CAS per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 18 percent to $890 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower ounces sold, higher direct operating costs, a draw-down of
            in-circuit inventory and lower by-product credits at Yanacocha. </p>
          <p> <b>Gold AISC per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup></b> increased 11 percent to $1,156 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to higher CAS per ounce. </p>
          <p> <b>Attributable gold equivalent ounce (GEO) production from other metals</b> increased 10 percent to 350 thousand ounces primarily due to higher ore grade milled at Pe&#241;asquito and Boddington. </p>
          <p> <b>CAS from other metals</b> totaled $251 million for the quarter. <b>CAS per GEO<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 29 percent to $717 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to higher allocation of costs to other metals at Pe&#241;asquito.
          </p>
          <p> <b>AISC per GEO<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup></b> increased 22 percent to $997 per ounce primarily due to higher CAS per GEO. </p>
          <p> <b>Net income</b> from continuing operations attributable to Newmont stockholders was $432 million or $0.54 per diluted share, a decrease of $106 million from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower gold sales volumes, higher CAS, a
            pension settlement charge of $130 million, the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment in 2022 compared to a gain on the sale of TMAC in 2021 and higher reclamation and remediation charges. These decreases were
            partially offset by higher average realized metal prices, unrealized gains on marketable and other equity securities in 2022 compared to unrealized losses in 2021 and lower income tax expense. </p>
          <p> <b>Adjusted net income<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">4</sup> </b>was $546 million or $0.69 per diluted share,<b> </b>compared to $594 million or $0.74 per diluted share in the prior year quarter. Primary adjustments to first quarter net income include pension
            settlement charges, changes in the fair value of investments, the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment, reclamation and remediation charges, settlement costs, a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian
            efforts in Ukraine, and valuation allowance and other tax adjustments. </p>
          <p> <b>Adjusted EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">5</sup></b> decreased 5 percent to $1.4 billion for the quarter, compared to $1.5 billion for the prior year quarter. </p>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> <b>Revenue </b>increased<b> </b>5 percent from the prior year quarter to $3.0 billion primarily due to higher average realized gold prices and higher copper sales volumes, which were partially offset by lower gold sales volumes. </p>
          <p> <b>Average realized price<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">6</sup></b> for gold was $1,892, an increase of $141 per ounce over the prior year quarter. Average realized gold price includes $1,883 per ounce of gross price received, the favorable impact of $17 per ounce
            mark-to-market on provisionally-priced sales and reductions of $8 per ounce for treatment and refining charges. </p>
          <p> <b>Capital expenditures<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">7</sup></b> increased 10 percent from the prior year quarter to $437 million primarily due to higher development capital spend, which was partially offset by lower sustaining capital spend. Development capital
            expenditures in 2022 primarily include advancing Tanami Expansion 2, Yanacocha Sulfides, Ahafo North, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. </p>
          <p> <b>Consolidated operating cash flow from continuing operations </b>decreased 18 percent from the prior year quarter to $689 million primarily due to lower gold sales volumes and an increase in accounts receivable related to timing of cash
            receipts. These decreases were partially offset by higher average realized metal prices.<b> Free Cash Flow<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">8</sup> </b>also decreased to $252 million primarily due to lower operating cash flow and higher development capital expenditures as
            described above. </p>
          <p> <b>Balance sheet and liquidity </b>ended the quarter with $4.3 billion of consolidated cash and approximately $7.3 billion of liquidity; reported net debt to adjusted EBITDA of 0.3x<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">9</sup>. </p>
          <p> <b>Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) </b>attributable gold production was 288 thousand ounces, with CAS of $899 per ounce and AISC of $1,086 per ounce for the first quarter. NGM EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">10</sup> was $278 million. </p>
          <p> <b>Pueblo Viejo (PV) </b>attributable gold production was 69 thousand ounces for the quarter. Pueblo Viejo EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">10</sup> was $80 million and cash distributions received for the Company's equity method investment totaled $49 million in
            the first quarter. </p>
          <p> <b>COVID UPDATE</b> </p>
          <p> Newmont continues to maintain wide-ranging protective measures for its workforce and neighboring communities, including screening, physical distancing, deep cleaning and avoiding exposure for at-risk individuals. The Company incurred
            incremental Covid specific costs of $17 million during the quarter for activities such as additional health and safety procedures, increased transportation and distributions from the Newmont Global Community Support Fund. The majority of the
            additional incremental Covid specific costs have not been adjusted from our non-GAAP metrics. </p>
          <p> <b>PROJECTS UPDATE<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">11</sup></b> </p>
          <p> Newmont&#8217;s project pipeline supports stable production with improving margins and mine life. Newmont's 2022 and longer-term outlook includes current development capital costs and production related to Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North, Yanacocha
            Sulfides, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. Additional projects not listed below represent incremental improvements to the Company's outlook. </p>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> <u>Tanami Expansion 2</u> (Australia) secures Tanami&#8217;s future as a long-life, low-cost producer with potential to extend mine life beyond 2040 through the addition of a 1,460 meter hoisting shaft and supporting
              infrastructure to process 3.3 million tonnes per year and provide a platform for future growth. The expansion is expected to increase average annual gold production by approximately 150,000 to 200,000 ounces per year for the first five years
              and is expected to reduce operating costs by approximately 10 percent. Capital costs for the project are estimated to be between $850 and $950 million with a commercial production date in 2024. Development costs (excluding capitalized
              interest) since approval were $333 million, of which $49 million related to the first quarter of 2022. </li>
          </ul>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> <u>Ahafo North</u> (Africa) expands our existing footprint in Ghana with four open pit mines and a stand-alone mill located approximately 30 kilometers from the Company&#8217;s Ahafo South operations. The project is
              expected to add between 275,000 and 325,000 ounces per year with all-in sustaining costs between $600 to $700 per ounce for the first five full years of production (2024-2028). Capital costs for the project are estimated to be between $750
              and $850 million with a construction completion date in late 2023 and commercial production in 2024. Ahafo North is the best unmined gold deposit in West Africa with approximately 3.5 million ounces of Reserves and more than 1 million ounces
              of Measured, Indicated and Inferred Resources and significant upside potential to extend beyond Ahafo North&#8217;s current 13-year mine life. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $95 million, of which $28 million
              related to the first quarter of 2022. </li>
          </ul>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> <u>Yanacocha Sulfides</u><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">12</sup> (South America) will develop the first phase of sulfide deposits and an integrated processing circuit, including an autoclave to produce 45% gold, 45% copper and 10% silver. The
              project is expected to add average annual production of 525,000 gold equivalent ounces per year with all-in sustaining costs between $700 and $800 per ounce for the first five full years of production (2027-2031). Total capital costs for the
              project are estimated at $2.5 billion, with an investment decision expected in late 2022 and a three year development period. The first phase focuses on developing the Yanacocha Verde and Chaquicocha deposits to extend Yanacocha&#8217;s operations
              beyond 2040 with second and third phases having the potential to extend life for multiple decades. </li>
          </ul>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> <u>Pamour</u> (North America) extends the life of Porcupine and maintains production beginning in 2024. The project will optimize mill capacity, adding volume and supporting high grade ore from Borden and Hoyle Pond,
              while supporting further exploration in a highly prospective and proven mining district. An investment decision is expected in the second half of 2022 with estimated capital costs between $350 and $450 million. </li>
          </ul>
          <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
            <li> <u>Cerro Negro District Expansion 1</u> (South America) includes the simultaneous development of the Marianas and Eastern districts to extend the mine life of Cerro Negro beyond 2030. The project is expected to
              improve production to above 350,000 ounces beginning in 2024, while improving all-in sustaining costs to between $800 and $900 per ounce. Capital costs for the project are estimated to be approximately $300 million. This project provides a
              platform for further exploration and future growth through additional expansions. </li>
          </ul>
          <p> <i>________________________________________________</i> </p>
          <p> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1</sup> <i>Attributable gold production for the first quarter 2022 includes 69 thousand ounces from the Company&#8217;s equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo (40%). <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Costs applicable to sales. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Costs applicable to sales. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">4</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">5</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">6</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Sales. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">7</sup> <i>Capital expenditures refers to Additions to property plant and mine development from the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">8</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation to Net cash provided by operating activities. <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">9</sup> <i>Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation. <br>
              <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">10</sup> Non-GAAP measure. See end of this release for reconciliation. <br>
              <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">11</sup> All-in sustaining costs are presented using a $1,200/oz gold price assumption. Project estimates remain subject to change based upon uncertainties, including future impacts Covid-19 and other cost pressures, supply chain
              disruptions and availabilities, commodity price volatility and other factors, which may impact estimated capital expenditures, AISC and timing of projects. See end of this release for cautionary statement regarding forward-looking statements.
              <br>
            </i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1<i>2</i></sup><i> Consolidated basis.</i> </p>
          <p> <b>OUTLOOK</b> </p>
          <p> Newmont&#8217;s outlook reflects increasing gold production and ongoing investment in its operating assets and most promising growth prospects. Outlook includes current development capital costs and production related to Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo
            North, Yanacocha Sulfides, Pamour at Porcupine and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. </p>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> Newmont continues to develop our mine plan utilizing a $1,200 per ounce gold price assumption. However, due to sustained higher gold prices over the last two years, Newmont&#8217;s 2022 outlook assumes an $1,800 per ounce revenue gold price for CAS
            and AISC to reflect higher costs from inflation, royalties and production taxes. In 2022, an additional 5% of cost escalation is incorporated into our direct operating costs related to labor, energy, and material and supplies. 2022 and
            longer-term outlook assumes a $30 per ounce impact from production taxes and royalties attributable to higher gold prices. Outlook assumes operations continue without major Covid-related interruptions. Newmont continues to maintain wide-ranging
            protective measures for its workforce and neighboring communities, including screening, physical distancing, deep cleaning and avoiding exposure for at-risk individuals, which are expected to impact AISC per gold equivalent ounce by
            approximately $10 per ounce. If at any point the Company determines that continuing operations poses an increased risk to our workforce or host communities, it will reduce operational activities up to, and including, care and maintenance and
            management of critical environmental systems. Please see the cautionary statement for additional information. </p>
          <p> For a more detailed discussion and outlook presented at a $1,200 per ounce gold price assumption, see the Company&#8217;s 2022 and Longer-Term Outlook released on December 2, 2021, available on www.newmont.com. The attributable site-level
            production for Yanacocha and attributable development capital guidance below accounts for the acquisition of Buenaventura's 43.65% interest in Yanacocha, as announced on February 8, 2022. All other guidance metrics remain unchanged from the
            Company's 2022 and Longer-Term Outlook as announced on December 2, 2021. </p>
          <p> <b>Five Year Outlook (+/- 5%): $1,800/oz Gold Price Assumption</b> </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="zd722c57b83d949188bba37e4bb762aaa" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 34%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Guidance Metric ($M) </b><i>(+/- 5%)</i> </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 6%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>2022E</b> </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 15%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>2023E</b> </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 15%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>2024E</b> </p>
                </td>

                </td>

                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 260 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 80%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Interest Expense </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;width: 20%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 225 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 80%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Depreciation &amp; Amortization </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;width: 20%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 2,300 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 80%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted Tax Rate <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a,b</sup> </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 20%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 30%-34% </p>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>
          <p> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a</sup> The adjusted tax rate excludes certain items such as tax valuation allowance adjustments. <br>
            <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">b</sup> Assuming average prices of $1,800 per ounce for gold, $3.25 per pound for copper, $23.00 per ounce for silver, $0.95 per pound for lead, and $1.15 per pound for zinc and achievement of current production and sales volumes and cost
            estimates, we estimate our consolidated adjusted effective tax rate related to continuing operations for 2022 will be between 30%-34%. </p>

          <p> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a</sup> 2022 outlook projections are considered forward-looking statements and represent management&#8217;s good faith estimates or expectations of future production results as of December 2, 2021. Outlook is based upon certain assumptions,
            including, but not limited to, metal prices, oil prices, certain exchange rates and other assumptions. For example, 2022 Outlook assumes $1,800/oz Au, $3.25/lb Cu, $23.00/oz Ag, $1.15/lb Zn, $0.95/lb Pb, $0.75 USD/AUD exchange rate, $0.80
            USD/CAD exchange rate and $60/barrel WTI. Production, CAS, AISC and capital estimates exclude projects that have not yet been approved, except for Yanacocha Sulfides, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1 which are included in Outlook.
            The potential impact on inventory valuation as a result of lower prices, input costs, and project decisions are not included as part of this Outlook. Assumptions used for purposes of Outlook may prove to be incorrect and actual results may
            differ from those anticipated, including variation beyond a +/-5% range. Outlook cannot be guaranteed. As such, investors are cautioned not to place undue reliance upon Outlook and forward-looking statements as there can be no assurance that
            the plans, assumptions or expectations upon which they are placed will occur. Amounts may not recalculate to totals due to rounding. The attributable production guidance accounts for the acquisition of Buenaventura's 43.65% interest in
            Yanacocha, as announced on February 8, 2022. All other guidance metrics remain unchanged from the Company's outlook as announced on December 2, 2021. See cautionary at the end of this release. <br>
            <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">b </sup>All-in sustaining costs (AISC) as used in the Company&#8217;s Outlook is a non-GAAP metric; see below for further information and reconciliation to consolidated 2022 CAS outlook. <br>
            <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">c </sup>Consolidated production for Yanacocha and Merian is presented on a total production basis for the mine site; attributable production represents a 95% interest for Yanacocha and a 75% interest for Merian. </p>
          <p> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">d </sup>Attributable production includes Newmont&#8217;s 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment. <br>
            <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">e </sup>Represents the ownership interest in the Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) joint venture. NGM is owned 38.5% by Newmont and owned 61.5% and operated by Barrick. The Company accounts for its interest in NGM using the proportionate
            consolidation method, thereby recognizing its pro-rata share of the assets, liabilities and operations of NGM. <br>
            <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">f </sup>Gold equivalent ounces (GEO) are calculated as pounds or ounces produced multiplied by the ratio of the other metal&#8217;s price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,200/oz.), Copper ($3.25/lb.), Silver ($23.00/oz.), Lead ($0.95/lb.), and
            Zinc ($1.15/lb.) pricing. </p>

                    attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote 1. Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in <i>Equity income (loss) of affiliates.</i> </p>

          </div>
          <p> <b>Non-GAAP Financial Measures</b> </p>
          <p> Non-GAAP financial measures are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standard meaning prescribed by GAAP. These measures should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance
            prepared in accordance with GAAP. Unless otherwise noted, we present the Non-GAAP financial measures of our continuing operations in the tables below. </p>
          <p> <b><i>Adjusted net income (loss)</i></b> </p>
          <p> Management uses Adjusted net income (loss) to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance and for planning and forecasting future business operations. The Company believes the use of Adjusted net income (loss) allows investors and others to
            understand the results of the continuing operations of the Company and its direct and indirect subsidiaries relating to the sale of products, by excluding certain items that have a disproportionate impact on our results for a particular period.
            Adjustments to continuing operations are presented before tax and net of our partners&#8217; noncontrolling interests, when applicable. The tax effect of adjustments is presented in the Tax effect of adjustments line and is calculated using the
            applicable regional tax rate. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of Adjusted net income (loss) are evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. <i>Net income
              (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</i> is reconciled to Adjusted net income (loss) as follows: </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="zc103a8e1868d4f88b9e3c6e6a3e6b369" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 71%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>
                <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="11">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended <br>
                      March 31, 2022</b> </p>
                </td>
              </tr>

              <tr>
                <td style="text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (1) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per share measures may not recalculate due to rounding. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (2) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Pension settlement, included in<i> Other income (loss), net</i>, represents pension settlement charges in 2022 related to the annuitization of certain defined benefit plans. For further
                    information, refer to Note 7 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (3) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investment in current and
                    non-current marketable and other equity securities. For further information regarding our investments, refer to Note 10 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (4) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, included in <i>Other income (loss), net,</i> primarily represents the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment. For
                    further information, refer to Note 7 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (5) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties
                    and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. Refer to Note 5 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statement for further information. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (6) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net,</i> primarily are comprised of legal settlement and a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (7) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes
                    implemented by the Company. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (8) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> The tax effect of adjustments, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (7), as described above, and
                    are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (9) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, alternative minimum tax
                    credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months ended March 31, 2022 reflects the
                    net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $12, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and
                    liabilities of $(3), net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $(12), and other tax adjustments of $1. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (10) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares in accordance with U.S. GAAP. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;">&#160;</td>

              <tr>
                <td style="text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (1) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per share measures may not recalculate due to rounding. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (2) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss)</i>, net, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses on marketable and other equity securities and our
                    investment instruments. For further information regarding our investments, refer to Note 10 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (3) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, included in <i>Other income (loss), net,</i> primarily represents a gain on the sale of TMAC. For further information, refer to Note 7 of the
                    Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (4) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties
                    and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. Refer to Note 5 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (5) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, net, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model
                    changes implemented by the Company. Total amount is presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $(1). </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (6) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents certain costs associated with legal and other settlements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (7) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> COVID-19 specific costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily includes amounts distributed from the Newmont Global Community Support Fund to help host communities, governments
                    and employees combat the COVID-19 pandemic. Adjusted net income (loss) has not been adjusted for $21 of incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our
                    operational sites. Refer to Note 6 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (8) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment of long-lived and other assets, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies
                    inventories. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (9) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> The tax effect of adjustments, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (8), as described above, and
                    are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (10) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, net, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, alternative minimum tax
                    credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment is due to a net increase or (decrease) to capital
                    losses, tax credit carryovers and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $21, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $(28), and other tax adjustments of $(2).
                    Total amount is presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $(2). </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;padding-left: 0px;vertical-align: top;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (11) </p>
                </td>
                <td style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 5px;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="1" rowspan="1">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares, which are calculated in accordance with U.S. GAAP. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> <b><i>Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization and Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization</i></b> </p>
          <p> Management uses EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance. EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA do not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income
            (loss), or cash flow from operations as those terms are defined by GAAP, and do not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are frequently used as measures of
            operations and the ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of Adjusted EBITDA is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that Adjusted
            EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of Adjusted EBITDA are
            evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders is reconciled to EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA as follows: </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="z80bdee2cd7124425b550cad9b17979e4" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 72%;">

                </td>
                <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;" colspan="7">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended </b><br>
                    <b>March 31,</b> </p>
                </td>

          <table cellspacing="0" id="z067cba2e92fd49eca87ab1d949fe08ec" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="text-align: left;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (1) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Pension settlement, included in<i> Other income (loss), net</i>, represents pension settlement charges in 2022 related to the annuitization of certain defined benefit plans. For further
                    information, refer to Note 7 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (2) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investments in current and
                    non-current marketable and other equity securities. For further information regarding our investments, refer to Note 10 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (3) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, included in <i>Other income (loss), net,</i> primarily represents the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment in
                    2022 and a gain on the sale of TMAC in 2021. For further information, refer to Note 7 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (4) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating properties
                    and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. Refer to Note 5 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statement for further information. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (5) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net,</i> are primarily comprised of a legal settlement and a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine in 2022.
                  </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (6) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes
                    implemented by the Company for all periods presented. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (7) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment of long-lived and other assets, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplied
                    inventories. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (8) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> COVID-19 specific costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily include amounts distributed from Newmont Global Community Support Fund to help host communities, governments and
                    employees combat the COVID-19 pandemic. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> (9) </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted EBITDA has not been adjusted for $17 and $21 of incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our
                    operational sites for the three months ended March 31, 2022 and 2021, respectively. </p>
                </td>
              </tr>

          </table>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> Additionally, the Company uses Pueblo Viejo EBITDA as a non-GAAP measure to evaluate the operating performance of its investment in the Pueblo Viejo mine. Pueblo Viejo EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to,
            <i>Equity income (loss) of affiliates</i>, as defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash distributions from Pueblo Viejo will match Pueblo Viejo EBITDA or earnings from affiliates. Although the Company has the ability to
            exert significant influence, it does not have direct control over the operations or resulting revenues and expenses, nor does it proportionately consolidate its investment in Pueblo Viejo. The Company believes that Pueblo Viejo EBITDA provides
            useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating the operating results of its investment in Pueblo Viejo, in the same manner as management and the Board of Directors. <i>Equity income (loss) of affiliates</i> is
            reconciled to Pueblo Viejo EBITDA as follows:&#8203; </p>

          <p> The Company uses NGM EBITDA as a non-GAAP measure to evaluate the operating performance of its investment in Nevada Gold Mines (NGM). NGM EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, Income (loss) before income
            and mining tax and other items, as defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash distributions from NGM will match NGM EBITDA. Although the Company has the ability to exert significant influence and proportionally consolidates
            its 38.5% interest in NGM, it does not have direct control over the operations or resulting revenues and expenses of its investment in NGM. The Company believes that NGM EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in
            understanding and evaluating the operating results of its investment in NGM, in the same manner as management and the Board of Directors. Income (loss) before income and mining tax and other items is reconciled to NGM EBITDA as follows: </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="z7460d45b0b6e42c5b89d1c56514160b4" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: double black 2.25pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 2%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $ </p>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: double black 2.25pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;width: 6%;">
                  <p style="text-align: right; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 294 </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;">(1) Refer to Note 3 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                </td>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                </td>

                </td>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> <b><i>Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
          <p> Management uses Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations. Free Cash Flow is <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i> less <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities
              of discontinued operations</i> less <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> as presented on the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. The Company believes Free Cash Flow is also useful as one of the bases for
            comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Free Cash Flow is
            not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. </p>
          <p> The presentation of non-GAAP Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to net income as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to cash flows from operating activities as a measure
            of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition of Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows
            available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is
            important to view Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. </p>
          <p> The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly
            comparable to Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="zbddc8049d76e47c7b7daef73035cfce3" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </i>includes<i> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</i> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash
                    Flow.&#8203; </p>

          <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
            <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
              <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
          </div>
          <p> <b><i>Attributable Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
          <p> Management uses Attributable Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations that are attributable to the Company. Attributable Free Cash Flow is <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>
            after deducting net cash flows from operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</i> after deducting net cash flows from discontinued operations
            attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> after deducting property, plant and mine development attributable to noncontrolling interests. The Company believes that Attributable Free
            Cash Flow is useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Attributable Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other
            companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Attributable Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. </p>
          <p> The presentation of non-GAAP Attributable Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to Net income attributable to Newmont stockholders as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to
            <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i> as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition of
            Attributable Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual
            obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Attributable Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements
            of Cash Flows. </p>
          <p> The following tables set forth a reconciliation of Attributable Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most
            directly comparable to Attributable Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>
          <table cellspacing="0" id="zb3d4d58c4b2e4c69a0d2066d055ef842" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 72%;">
                  <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                </td>
                <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="11">
                  <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended March 31, 2022</b> </p>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 72%;">
